name: THE DRAGON PROPHET: BARBARIAN 28/ BARD 2/ RDD 10
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Once again the RDD reveals his power, this time adding to the already mighty Barbarian a Strenght beyond comprehension. With this build i focus on STRength and Terrifying Rage while giving this warrior all the necessary tools to properly do his job. An unparalleled DC for Terrifying Rage is accompanied by an almigty DC for Devastating Critical plus an attack bonus that very few can match and a skill & feat set that is one of the most accomplished a warrior has seen. This build literally, reeks with power.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here is the Non-Devastating Critical version of the Dragon Prophet. Enough things change for this one (including Race) so it is better if i post the whole build instead of writing down the alterations.

This one is much stronger! With the Improved Version of Knockdown & a 50 AB. He still has an unearthly save DC for his Terrifying Rage & he can fall back on Expertise mode if he needs to that when compined with his Dragonic armour it makes him almost impossible to be hit. I changed the weapon as well, since we do not have Dev. Critical anymore - let them feel our Criticals at the fullest, and so i went with the more Barbarian-like GreatAxe.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: WOW!

posts.author: JimDandy
posts.content:
The saves are low, but something has to be, lol! Nifty work. I'm curious how you'd build someone like Ryld, btw. I think that'd be very helpful for me in figuring out the Drow I want to make. I've reviewing 3 versions for pros and cons, but I'll bring that up in my own thread. This is fantastic for my Half-Ogre fun!

I'd consider getting buffs via items for getting the max out of the existing Medium Armor and take Exotic for that Scythe, but it's tougher to justify (I guess) when there aren't any EDRs to back up the innate Barbarian DR that would make lower AC OK as you'd soak up most of the damage.

Love to see these builds of yours


-JimDandy

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
No medium armour for any of my Barbarians, all of them have full plate (look at the very first feat they take) Jim.

Or if you are talking about Ryld, he has clearly Fighter & Wmaster training in there too , so again full plate for him. He was actually very proud for his Dwarven-made plate he was wearing. Third class is to be considered though. Better to talk about him in your thread though and make accurate suggestions there.


thanks for the input guys,
